comment: Felt no respect by him. He didnt even know my name and didnt know how to grade. Hard class. I just didnt like him personally and as a teacher(if you can call him that since he doesnt do his job)
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Offered no help, explains things in a very difficult way, gets frustrated when questions are asked.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Calc is typically a hard class but Dr. Wesselink made it a breeze. At the beg. of the semester he gives everyone his personal cellphone number and encourages you to contact him with any questions. He also hosts a saturday review session before each test. He cared that each student did well in his class and even had morning office hours before class
rating_tags: Caring

comment: Wesselink is an older professor who really cares for the success of his students. He always does his best to answer any questions anyone might have. There is opportunity for extra credit throughout the semester by homework and attendance. On average, there are about 2 homework assignments due each week. Great class, although I didn't use the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mr. Wesselink is a polite teacher but he gives a lot of work on Web-assign. We have homework weekly and it doesn't really help because they are usually very hard and without any examples of videos to show us. He does offer tutoring but is not the best tutor because of his old-fashioned methods. He doesn't make sure everyone understands the work.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would not have been successful in this class without Professor Wesselink. He works very hard to help his students, especially if you need extra help. He is available through text and private tutoring. He is very intelligent, caring, and likes hard workers. This class is not easy, but if you put in the effort, you will be fine! I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I wasnt overly fond of Wesselink in the beginning because hes older and sometimes forgets his place and stuff but once I learned how to self teach the math, he easily filled in the gap. Met him 50/50 and it worked out. He tries very hard to meet you in the middle tho and is available via text. Lots of tests and quizzes but you might be grateful!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: TAKE HIM IF YOURE BAD AT MATH! Before this class, I took algebra & had to withdrawal because I was failing. However, in this class I made a solid B. He gives extra credit at the end of the semester & increases your overall grade by 2 points if you have less than 3 absences. He grades kind of annoying (if you dont label).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: It's calc. He's fine, but class is tough. No extra credit, but since you'll need to attend to do well it can boost your grade 2%. Four tests and final. Final can replace lowest. Five quizzes, can drop lowest. Lot of homework, but if you do in advacnce, you get bonus pts- saved my grade. You can text/meet him out of class. Partial credit, show work!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof. Wesselink is the best math teacher I've had in a long time. He was so helpful! He has office hours, week-end study sessions for tests, and is willing to help if you just ask. He offers quite a bit of extra credit too: if you do hw early or just not missing class you get extra credit! Love this guy!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor Wesselink was an average teacher. He taught most things in a way that is understandable. Tests are fair if you come to class, take notes, & do the study guide. Had to buy mymathlab which was expensive af and HW personally didnt help me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you have to take an intro math class, DO NOT take this class. Professor Wesselink is a nice guy and a good teacher but the material is so hard. I have always been good at math but I really struggled in this class. Professor Wesselink is very understanding and is willing to help in any way, but the class is hard. Do HW early for 20 extra points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is really nice and makes himself so accessible for his students. Talks a lot but he means well.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: An amazing teacher. Can go on about things that do not specifically matter but still a very good teacher. Of course the class is hard, but I believe he could be one of the best to teach it at the university. He is very caring and will help in anyway to make sure you get a good grade. You have to show you want the grade and put work into the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tests? Not many--TEST HEAVY

comment: I retook Precalc with Prof Wesselink after making a C 2 years ago and got an A+. His class was incredibly easy. Take notes and do the homework and you can get an A. He's straight forward and you can text him with questions and meet with him if necessary. Quiz dates are posted on D2L and exams are almost identical to review sheets. Take him!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: SO HELPFUL. He gives his number so students can text him questions for HW 24/7. He also has in-person office hours. He is also helpful in class. His teaching style is a little more old-fashioned, but it still works. Do the work and you will be fine. The material is easy, but I simply would not have passed this class without his help. Take him!
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: He was a great professor, he really cared about his students! He will sit down and help anyone. I would take him again in a heartbeat!

If you have even the slightest bit of struggle in math, do not take him. Mr. Wesselink moves very quickly and his lectures are very drawn out and boring. He doesn't tell you about quizzes, so you just have to check D2L to know if you have one. Tests are hard and not like the study guide. He is, however, easily accessible outside of the classroom.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Gives two or three HW assignments a week, but super easy and help a lot. He gives you a way to reach him and he will always respond and talk you through the problem. The study guides are exactly like the test and he reviews the study in class before the test so if you don't understand he will work it out for you. A lot of lecture and can be boring.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Wesselink lectures daily. If you miss a day you will get behind. His tests are just like his study guides which makes them easy A's. He is an average grader, he will give half credit on wrong problems. He never gives multiple choice. There is  a lot of homework but he doesn't care if you do it in class. His lectures match up with the HW.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Wesselink was a good professor and his class was not that hard. It was a homework heavy class that you do most of the work online.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is very clear about what is expected. You have quizzes every few sections and tests on each chapter. He provides practice tests which are SUPER helpful and mimic the real thing. He also gives you extra credit if you only miss a class or 2. I made a 94 on the final by only doing the practice exam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice professor  genuinely interested in students.  Holds Saturday study sessions before exams. Stays after for anyone needing help.  This is a tough class, be prepared to study a ton!!  4 exams but he will drop the lowest one plus the final.  Gives 2 points for perfect attendance
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. I went to tutoring, got help outside of class, and did all the homework but still came out with a horrible grade. The test are extremely hard and he is a tough grader. If you do not understand anything from the beginning of the class, you will FAIL. I regret taking this class and wish I had dropped it b4 it was too late.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but HIGHLY recommended. Gives extra credit for low absence numbers. Go to class, listen in class, do the homework, and you will pass easily. Nice guy that likes in-class participators.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is so good. I love him. He is always reachable for questions too. He's a sweet old man. Take him. You will like him. He's simple and straightforward. Be careful of the quizzes. He will post the pop quiz dates randomly on d21
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I honestly can't tell you the last time I actually understood it but with Dr. Wesselink this was not the case . There is a lot of homework but it is extremely beneficial and if you don't understand a question you can text him and he will explain it. His lectures may be boring but helpful. He posts practice tests that will help you prepare for tests
rating_tags: Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very easy, knows he's not teaching Chemistry majors. Will make a point to answer any and all questions asked and explains to the whole class. Provides practice tests with an answer key so you can see how you're doing AND if you complete the homework 48 hours in advance of the due date you get a 10% bonus.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I loved Professor Wesselink! His lectures were very informative and he really works through the problems. If you have any questions, he'll go step-by-step for you. The first class, Professor Wesselink gives you his phone number and if you have any homework questions, you can text him for help. Super helpful and invested in your success in the class
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Typical math class. Pretty good teacher except he likes to just ramble on about the moat random stuff one time. There are 4 test and 3 or 4 quizes. The final which is the 4th test can also replace your lowest test grade. Homework is done on Webassign and he usually gives two assignments on that a week. YOU DO NOT NEED THE BOOK AT ALL

Awesome math teacher! There's a lot of homework, but plenty of time to complete it. He will help you over text messaging if you send him a photo of the problem. He's extremely bright, and knows the material like the back of his hand. He also gives credit at the end of the course for good attendance. Highly recommend.

Homework is all online and he explains the material well enough where I didn't have any trouble understanding. He gets annoyed with students who ask questions, and I thought disrespectful at times. But he did always answer their questions. He made me roll my eyes a lot, but the course was easy to comprehend.
Failed this class the first time I took it with a different professor and now I am making B's on the tests. He is one of the most clear math classes I have ever taken.

He is a great teacher! He explains the units very well in class and answers any questions thrown at him. Also the homework he gives is not only easy but helpful. I would take him again because I'm not good at math and I got an A.

Dr. Wesselink is very dedicated to making sure his students succeed. His lecture can be sorta confusing and long however a lot can be learned from the homework. He answers ever question you'll ever have and even responds to text messages.  Final was comprehensive and he even set us up an extra study period with him the day before. Highly recommend.

He was very helpful when it came to answering questions, but sometimes he wasn't very clear on things in his lectures. I learned more from the homework than his lectures. Easy A if you do the homework.

Prof. Wesselink is beyond compare.  He is dedicated to helping students succeed, and expects you to do your part.  He offers extra credit and test study guides that are near identical to the actual tests.  He even hosted a 3 hour study session outside class on his day off before the final.  If you get the chance, take him.  You won't regret it.
very sweet man, gives online homework assignment for each class.
Really helpful and easy to understand. Answers most questions and explains most material in class.

Prof Weaseling is a fantastic professor! I plan on taking him for Calculus later in my college career. He's very friendly, very understanding, and is always an email away. I enjoyed his class and he made math very bearable.

I absolutely loved him! Hes such a sweet man and always offers study sessions before every test. There is online homework every night you have class, but its easy. The tests are very similar to the quizzes and practice tests. I would definitely recommend him!!

Professor Wesselink was the best math teacher I have ever had! I took this class in the previous semester with a different professor and failed the class so I had to retake it. I am not very good at math but I got an A! He gives extra points to your final grade for good attendance. Homework is not mandatory, but you have a quiz each class over it.
